title.value: Amplifying Pathological Detection in EEG Signaling Pathways through Cross-Dataset Transfer Learning
title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Amplifying Pathological Detection in EEG Signaling Pathways through Cross-Dataset Transfer Learning

extractions.description: This paper explores the use of cross-dataset transfer learning to enhance pathology detection in EEG signals. It demonstrates the effectiveness of data and model scaling when transferring knowledge from a source dataset to a target dataset, especially in scenarios with limited labeled data. The study evaluates performance improvements with different models and highlights critical factors such as data normalization and preprocessing for achieving positive transfer.

type.justification: The paper involves experiments with different models and datasets to evaluate the effectiveness of transfer learning for EEG pathology detection, indicating it is empirical.
type.quote: In this study, we explore a real-world pathology classification task to highlight the effectiveness of data and model scaling and cross-dataset knowledge transfer. As such, we observe varying performance improvements through data scaling.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on processing EEG signals for pathology detection using deep learning techniques, which falls under Biomedical Signal Processing.
name.quote: Pathology diagnosis based on EEG signals and decoding brain activity holds immense importance in understanding neurological disorders.

name.justification: The study emphasizes using transfer learning techniques to improve the performance of EEG pathology detection models by transferring knowledge from a source to a target dataset.
name.quote: We see improvement in the performance of the target model on the target (NMT) datasets by using the knowledge from the source dataset (TUAB) when a low amount of labelled data was available.

name.justification: The paper extensively discusses and utilizes deep learning models like ShallowNet, Deep4Net, TCN-EEG, and EEGNet for the task of EEG pathology detection.
name.quote: Our findings indicate a small and generic model (e.g. ShallowNet) performs well on a single dataset, however, a larger model (e.g. TCN) performs better on transfer and learning from a larger and diverse dataset.

name.justification: ShallowNet is one of the models used in the experiments to evaluate its performance for EEG pathology detection.
name.quote: ShallowNet [18]: A shallow convolutional neural network that consists of two convolutional layers, each followed by a max-pooling layer and a dropout layer.

is_contributed.justification: ShallowNet was utilized in this study, but it was not introduced as a new model in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: ShallowNet [18]: A shallow convolutional neural network that consists of two convolutional layers, each followed by a max-pooling layer and a dropout layer.

is_executed.justification: ShallowNet was executed in the experiments conducted in this paper.
is_executed.quote: We trained several well-known EEG models while altering the number of recordings in the training set... ShallowNet: A shallow convolutional neural network

is_compared.justification: ShallowNet's performance was compared numerically with other models in the experiments.
is_compared.quote: Table 1 shows the summary of the models that we used in our experiments. It includes the name, the architecture, the number of parameters, and the original reference of each model.

referenced_paper_title.value: Deep learning with convolutional neural networks for EEG decoding and visualization

name.justification: Deep4Net is one of the models used in the experiments for EEG pathology detection.
name.quote: Deep4Net has 277052 trainable parameters and was originally proposed for EEG-based emotion recognition.

is_contributed.justification: Deep4Net was employed in this study, but it was not introduced as a new model in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: Deep4Net [18]: A deep convolutional neural network that consists of four convolutional blocks, each followed by a max-pooling layer and a dropout layer.

is_executed.justification: Deep4Net was executed in the experiments described in this paper.
is_executed.quote: We trained several well-known EEG models while altering the number of recordings in the training set... Deep4Net: A deep convolutional neural network

is_compared.justification: Deep4Net's performance and characteristics were compared with other models in the experiments.
is_compared.quote: We experimented with five models with at least five different seeds for each of them... Deep4Net has 277052 trainable parameters.

referenced_paper_title.quote: Deep4Net [18]: A deep convolutional neural network that consists of four convolutional blocks, each followed by a max-pooling layer and a dropout layer.

name.justification: TCN-EEG is one of the models used and tested in the experiments for pathology detection in EEG.
name.quote: TCN-EEG [19]: A temporal convolutional network that consists of several residual blocks, each containing two dilated causal convolutional layers and different dilation rates.

is_contributed.justification: TCN-EEG was utilized in this study, but it was not a new contribution of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: TCN-EEG [19]: A temporal convolutional network that consists of several residual blocks, each containing two dilated causal convolutional layers and different dilation rates.

is_executed.justification: TCN-EEG was executed in the experiments described in the paper.
is_executed.quote: We trained several well-known EEG models while altering the number of recordings in the training set... TCN-EEG: A temporal convolutional network

is_compared.justification: TCN-EEG was compared numerically with other models as part of the study.
is_compared.quote: Table 1 shows the summary of the models that we used in our experiments. It includes the name, the architecture, the number of parameters, and the original reference of each model.

referenced_paper_title.quote: TCN-EEG [19]: A temporal convolutional network that consists of several residual blocks, each containing two dilated causal convolutional layers and different dilation rates.

name.justification: EEGNet is one of the models used in the experiments for the EEG pathology detection task.
name.quote: EEGNet [17]: EEGNet is a compact convolutional neural network that can be used for EEG-based brain-computer interfaces.

is_executed.justification: EEGNet was executed in the experiments described in this study.
is_executed.quote: We trained several well-known EEG models while altering the number of recordings in the training set... EEGNet: EEGNet is a compact convolutional neural network

name.value: Temple University Hospital Abnormal EEG Corpus (TUAB)
name.justification: The TUAB (Temple University Hospital Abnormal) EEG dataset is extensively used and referenced in the study for transfer learning experiments.
name.quote: We investigated the knowledge transferability across two pathological detection datasets, The widely used Temple University Hospital Abnormal (TUAB) and the new NUST-MH-TUKL (NMT)

referenced_paper_title.value: The Temple University Hospital EEG data corpus
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper where the TUAB dataset was described and made available.

name.justification: The NUST-MH-TUKL (NMT) EEG dataset is used as the target dataset in the transfer learning experiments.
name.quote: We investigated the knowledge transferability across two pathological detection datasets... and the new NUST-MH-TUKL (NMT) scalp EEG dataset

referenced_paper_title.value: The NMT scalp EEG dataset: an open-source annotated dataset of healthy and pathological EEG recordings for predictive modeling
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper where the NMT dataset was described and made available.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The NMT EEG dataset is an open-source annotated dataset of healthy and pathological EEG recordings
